channel.title: dataStructures on full-stack overflow
channel.description: Recent content in dataStructures on thmsdnnr.com
channel.copyright: Â© 2017-2020 thomas danner // Vitae theme for Hugo

item.title: Lightning Fast String Lookups With Tries
item.description: Tries are a hybrid data structure combining a tree and hash table to provide O(k) lookup for k-character words, popular for use cases like typeahead and autocomplete.

item.title: Binary Heaps: Min-Heaps and Max-Heaps
item.description: Binary Heaps are binary-tree based data structures that can be used to implement a Priority Queue and provide O(1) insert and find-minimum performance.

item.title: AVL Trees Part 2: Insertions
item.description: Taking an in-depth look at node rebalancing after insertions in AVL trees.

item.title: AVL Trees Part 1: Balanced Binary Search and Rotations
item.description: AVL trees are self-balancing binary trees that avoid worst-case O(n) performance given increasing or decreasing inputs.

item.title: Binary Tree Application: Binary Space Partitioning
item.description: Binary space partitioning recursively subdivides a space. It is an application of binary trees and often used for procedurally generated game levels or computational art.

item.title: Binary Search Trees: Handling Deletion
item.description: Handling deletion in Binary Search Trees for nodes with zero, one, and two children.

item.title: Intro to Binary Search Trees
item.description: Binary Search Trees are are a data structure allowing O(log(N)) lookup of entries. We implement insertion, traversal, and search methods for Binary Search Trees.

item.title: Intro to Linked Lists
item.description: The Singly Linked List is a classic data structure. We implement length, insert, remove, and search methods, and compare the Linked List's big-O complexity to arrays.

item.title: Stacks, Queues, and Matching Brackets
item.description: Introducing the Stack and Queue data structures, using the Stack to implement a Code Linter to check for mismatched open and closing brackets.
